title: I deserved the chat restriction, but I figured I'd post the log anyway. This is the system we have.
body:
Here's the log, with my remembrance of what was said to me:

Game 1
In-Game
Kat XD: sigh
Kat XD: fucking kidding me
Kat XD: with this
Kat XD: dc
Kat XD: i am going to quit my job, cash my last paycheck, buy a longneck rifle
Kat XD: and snipe the ceo of comcast
Kat XD: ...
Pyke: kat wtf
Kat XD: i thought you would take aggro pyke lol
Darius: imagine putting a champion as your name and being this trash
Kat XD: thats the life of a kat main
Darius: no you just int and troll
Kat XD: it happens
Kat XD: sorry dad
Darius pings every item I have and continues pinging me on cooldown for several minutes.
Kat XD: keep pinging
Darius: you troll and int
Darius (All): x9 kat int and troll toxic
Kat XD: emotional loser
Kat XD: you want me to int and troll?
Darius: you already are r%%%%%
Kat XD: oh no no no
Kat XD: i can prove you wrong if you like
Darius: too late im reporting you already
Kat XD: darius you ever had a bad game?
Kat XD: never a single one?
Kat XD: youve never had a bad game right, you're perfect huh
Kat XD: yeah i bet you are
Kat XD: i bet every day your mommy tells you that you are her special boy
Darius (All): remember x9 kat toxic int and troll
(Enemy team tries to dive me at our inhib turret and gets double killed)
Kat XD: xd
Kat XD: wtf was that play by them
(We are rotating up, Darius is sweeping our top side jungle and walks past a ward, I get 2 hits on it and the sweeper wears off, so I ping theres vision there, then I get cut off by the enemy team and dove 3v1 while the rest of my team is 3 man clearing a wave top lane, then they rotate down and get caught out as well and die, then ping me like it was my fault somehow)
Darius: look see kat int and troll x9 report
Kat XD: first off, you fucking left a ward there
Kat XD: after sweeping
Kat XD: second
Kat XD: you saw them chasing me i pinged multiple times and you didnt even come until they dove me
Kat XD: so dont talk shit
Darius: just ff this game is over we can't win
Kat XD: because you suck at carrying
Kat XD: you arent good enough
Kat XD: sucks to be so bad that you can carry darius
Kat XD: cant*
Darius: report kat x9 toxic feeder troll
Kat XD: lmao you started it
Kat XD: imagine being this big a soy boy
Kat XD: imagine flaming someone, then getting butthurt when they flame you back
Kat XD: thats the society we live in
Darius: you can't even play kat with kat in your name imagine being a one trick and this garbage
Kat XD: god darius you are the worst human being ive ever run into in my life
Kat XD: and this is league of legends
Kat XD: saying nothing about your skill, im sure youre decent enough
Kat XD: just a bad person
(At this point Darius stops flaming me and starts shot calling with pings, you'll notice that I also stop responding to him... amazing! I'm no longer being flamed and I'm not flaming back, what do you know?)
We ace the enemy team.
Kat XD: fuck em up
Kat XD: bunch of losers man playing meta bullshit they deserve to lose
Kat XD: no loyalty to champs just flavor of the month
Darius: inhib or baron?
Kat XD: up to you boss
Kat XD: ty for turning the attitude around its helping me focus better
Kat XD: gg
Post-Game
Kat XD: bro darius
Kat XD: why didnt you start off like that
Kat XD: instead of flaming lol
Kat XD: you carried with calls
Darius: x9 kat toxic troll int and feed
Kat XD: wow dude attacks me all game
Kat XD: and calls me toxic
Kat XD: ik i had a bad game
Kat XD: sorry im not flawless like him
Neeko: neeko is really strong right now
Kat XD: yeah i know
Kat XD: meta slaves irk me
Kat XD: no loyalty to champs
Neeko: nah I just like neeko lol
Kat XD: xd
Kat XD: fair enough

replies.body:
> Kat XD: i am going to quit my job, cash my last paycheck, buy a longneck rifle
> Kat XD: and snipe the ceo of comcast

You are exceedingly lucky that you did not receive a permanent ban and police/FBI at your door for this sort of threat. Absolutely not okay.

****
On a more general note, why are you posting this sort of "this system sucks" post (and don't lie, that's what your title means) when you understand fully why you were punished?

Because I know what the rules are, I just disagree that they should be the rules. Also I've been paying over $200 a month for the last 3 years for sub-standard internet, and have no other options because comcast has a monopoly in my area. I get frequent disconnects and slow speeds even though I'm paying for a top-tier connection, and I never get through to customer support because comcast doesn't have a big enough CS department to handle all the issues. They know these are problems and have been for a very long time, yet they do nothing about it because they don't have to since they have a monopoly. That is EVIL and evil should be destroyed without mercy.

Of course I'm not going to follow through with something that outlandish, but it feels good to vent. It's unfortunate that we live in a society of people who demand that everyone tip-toe over every sensitive issue and never confront them head-on lest they be labeled a nazi.

I'm sorry to hear about your internet troubles, but that doesn't give you the right to make what amounts to a terroristic threat against their CEO.

I don't think you grasp this. You could be thrown in jail, and convicted of a felony, for that one line - should someone choose to press charges. Is it likely? Eh... maybe not. But it's against the law and for good reason. A felony.

****
And what do you disagree with? You think you should be able to flame/harass others without penalty?

Whatever it's obvious that I was just venting, if the FBI wants to come break down my door over a venting session in a video game they are more than welcome to.
--------------------------------------------------------------
I think that if someone flames or harasses me first I should have the choice of either muting and reporting them, or giving them a taste of their own medicine. I never report unless someone is using hate speech.
And what about the other innocent players who have to watch you doing that? Do they not deserve a game free from flaming/harassment?

I'm not flaming them, it's directed at someone else.

If you were walking down the street and you see some guy harassing some random person who looks to be minding their own business, then that second person starts screaming back at the first person, would you think to yourself "boy that second guy sure is an asshole, why is he retaliating instead of just taking it? I'm going to side with the guy who started the harassment because that second guy who's defending himself is obviously a bad person!"
If they were causing a disturbance, they'd both be arrested.

Don't avoid the issue, who is at fault? Which one is the bad person? I'm not talking from a legal standpoint. Which person, from a moral perspective, deserves what they got? The person who started the confrontation, or the person who retaliated?
When the actions of both are negatively impacting the game for innocent players, both.

It's important to highlight how far one "joke"/"threat" can go - a few days ago we had a case involving the FBI and german police as one kid in Bavaria (?) was mad and told he had plans running amok at the company. Sadly people underestimate what consequences their actions can have.

Oh i agree with you that it is important, but having 1 case of it doesnt mean every case will be the same. How many times does someone say something out of frustration and it means nothing. Where i do understand your point and to some extent i do agree with it. Not everyone is actually a psychopath attempting crazy acts of violence.

The problem is that nobody knows it means nothing.

If you treat things as if they mean nothing, you miss those where it meant *something*.

In this specific case do you really believe it meant something is what im saying. If he was going to really do it would he be posting chat logs right now or preparing to do it? Like he accepted his punishment too and he said he'd thought to post it anyways. It shows how the fact that he flamed the darius back made the darius back off and focus on the game instead of focusing on flaming him. Where most people always say "flaming NEVER helps"

>It shows how the fact that he flamed the darius back made the darius back off and focus on the game instead of focusing on flaming him.

This type of logic is not in the inhuman robot adjudicator's programming.

DOES NOT COMPUTE!

I.E. if someone can't handle being flamed, maybe they shouldn't have flamed in the first place. If you come at me with some bullshit when I'm minding my own business, I'm going to give it back 10x as hard. There was no reason to come at me, which means you are attacking me for no reason, and I should have the right to defend myself instead of crying for the teacher to come over like a little baby.

Yep. And if someone can't handle having their house set on fire, they shouldn't have put somebody else's house on fire.
Can't handle being raped? Shouldn't have raped.
Or generally: Can't handle having crime imposed on you? Shouldn't have been a criminal.

You're not advocating for self defense. You're advocating for vigilantism; for retaliation without any oversight whatsoever.
You have no right to "give it back 10x as hard". Even in situations in real life where self defense would in principle be applicable, this statement alone pretty much disqualifies you from using that excuse.

Those rights you believe you should have? You don't have them. Not within LoL's rules, and not within the laws of any civilized country.
The Punisher is my favorite superhero, and in my opinion, he's never made a single mistake after taking on the Punisher persona.

And yet the punisher probably isn't so much of a coward that he hides behind the concept of self defense. He makes it very clear, already by his name, that his intent is not to defend. It is to punish.

If you want to be a vigilante so badly, come to terms with the fact that **by definition** the actions of a vigilante do not follow the established rules. The problem here is not "the system we have", but your inability/unwillingness to conform to the most basic principle of **any** justice system.

Anti Hero*

Also depends on how you want to define mistake. There was the time he tried to kill Spidey when Spidey was accused of being a murderer. Another when he killed the Marvel Universe, all "Super Humans". He also realizes and accepts if he ever managed to get rid of all criminals, there would be one person left to pumish, himself.
Fair enough, but we all know the world will never be rid of evil, until it ends, whether we like it or not : /
Made me laugh, even if its a threat.

Accepting your punishment should mean that you accept responsibility for it. Comcast's poor connection didn't cause your negative behavior, nor did others' chat in that game.

You come across negative players-mute them and play the game, then half of your logs aren't responses to them.
Of course, that's why I understand that, within the ruleset imposed on me by Riot Games, I deserved this chat restriction. My own morals disagree, but that doesn't matter because groupthink.

> [{quoted}](name=Kat XD,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=IW2aZH3H,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-10-01T07:09:53.985+0000)
>
> Of course, that's why I understand that, within the ruleset imposed on me by Riot Games, I deserved this chat restriction. My own morals disagree, but that doesn't matter because groupthink.

Well, I'd really encourage you to take an honest look at your own chat, not others', and think about whether or not anything you said was going to help your team win.

I fully understand that my chat was 'unacceptable' based on the rules I agreed to when I created my account. I've not denied that at any point. What I disagree with on personal moral grounds is the idea that I should have to take a passive approach or risk punishment. In my opinion, it's amoral to demand that someone not come to their own defense, and to punish them on the quite rare occasion that they do.

I wish I could post logs from the hundred other games I've played recently where nobody flames and I'm encouraging my team, making calls, and joking around.

So lets put a number to it because reasons: 99% of the time I'm creating a neutral or positive experience for my teammates, and 1% of the time someone attacks me in game and I lash out in defense of myself.

That 1% nullifies the overall positive effect I have on the game environment, when removing the person who's being antagonistic in the first place would prevent the situation entirely.

Please don't tell me this makes sense to you from a moral standpoint, I can't afford to lose any more faith in humanity.

> [{quoted}](name=Kat XD,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=IW2aZH3H,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2019-10-01T07:24:23.848+0000)
>
> In my opinion, it's amoral to demand that someone not come to their own defense, and to punish them on the quite rare occasion that they do.

Is it amoral to impose rules on how self defense may be conducted?

>Is it amoral to impose rules on how self defense may be conducted?

Only if the rule boils down to "You may not defend yourself."

Well, then what's the problem?
You **are** allowed to defend yourself.
You can defend yourself verbally as long as you stick to the rules.
You can mute people.
You can report people.

You can do everything that is actually necessary to defend yourself.

You can certainly ask Riotbsupport how many recent games you've been validly reported in compared to the games you were encouraging. 

My guess; 20% toxic, 5% encouraging, 75% neutral.

Also, self defense in this game is to use a barrier that protects from all further incoming harm, AKA the mute button. Counter attacks are not a defense.

>Counter attacks are not a defense.

_The entire history of civilization wants to know your location._
{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}
The world we live in is a direct result of the "good guys" retaliating (counter attacking) in defense of our countries and ways of life.
It's still an attack regardless of how you want to spin it, not an actual defense.
That's too philosophical of a point to state as a fact.

> [{quoted}](name=Kat XD,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=IW2aZH3H,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2019-10-01T07:24:23.848+0000)
>
> Please don't tell me this makes sense to you from a moral standpoint, I can't afford to lose any more faith in humanity.

I understand the negativity received in game and the need to respond to that. I don't think that toxic players are going to care about you, which is why they were negative to begin with. So I don't see them caring at all about your "defense" or opinions you hold of them.

I suppose I've come to understand it's ultimately futile to converse with negative players, as they choose that path in game and rarely change course. Added to that, I'm just too busy playing the game to worry about the behavior of another player. 

I'm honor 4-3, and even if I've had a good history of being honorable, I don't expect that to shield me from punishment if I were to start insulting other players.

So I don't get it. They make the tilt-types thing, which in my opinion legitimizes my "tilt style" as a valid response to in-game stress, (barbarian here.) They make the vent bot as a way to vent, but I need to vent NOW. Am I supposed to go AFK and hop onto the vent bot in the middle of a match? AFK is against the rules. Venting is against the rules. Every outlet for my frustrations that will allow me to calm down and resume the match in a peaceful manner is against the rules.

It's like saying "we recognize that people like you exist, but we don't care because you don't think like us and that's not ok."
Yikes.
There is no way you remember every single thing he said and when. For all we know you made all that shit up.

> [{quoted}](name=FioraWillCarry,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=IW2aZH3H,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-10-01T08:37:50.461+0000)
>
> There is no way you remember every single thing he said and when. For all we know you made all that shit up.

Could have just recorded it.
For all I know you are a purple space alien from the planet Nebutron-z, what's your point?
So could you. There is no rule or reason that everyone posting here should be Humans for Earth. That's not even relevant or the point.

i agree completely with this, league of legends..... defend yourself and get punished.. the loophole here is you need to do the harassing, then you're completely safe from riot games punishment system, and if you're still worried just intentionally feed, they love when people do that.... (i really wish i was joking)
